labels.analysis: The MCP Server functions as a comprehensive system monitoring tool, providing real-time metrics for various hardware and network components. It addresses performance diagnostics, resource management, and network assessment by offering detailed insights into CPU, memory, disk, network traffic, battery status, and internet speed. The tools are designed to help users troubleshoot system bottlenecks and optimize resource utilization.
labels.reasoning: The primary functionality aligns closely with Operating System management, given its focus on system metrics and diagnostics. Secondary relevance to Data Analysis & Processing emerges from its capability to measure performance metrics over time. No custom label is needed as the predefined categories sufficiently cover the server's purpose.

tools.name: get_cpu_usage
tools.description: Returns the current CPU usage as a percentage, including overall load and load per core. Useful for identifying if high CPU usage is causing system slowdowns.

tools.name: get_memory_usage
tools.description: Returns the current memory usage, including total, used, and free memory in GB, plus the percentage used. Helps diagnose memory-related performance issues.

tools.name: get_disk_space
tools.description: Returns the disk space usage for the largest drive, including total, used, and free space in GB, plus the percentage used. Useful for checking available storage.

tools.name: get_network_usage
tools.description: Returns current network usage for the most active interface, including received (RX) and transmitted (TX) rates in KB/s, and total data since boot in MB. Useful for monitoring bandwidth consumption.

tools.name: get_battery_status
tools.description: Returns the current battery status, including charge percentage, charging state, and estimated time remaining (if applicable). Useful for laptops or devices to monitor power levels.

tools.name: get_internet_speed
tools.description: Measures and returns the current internet speed by testing download rate using a user-uploaded file and upload rate with a 1MB POST to Postman Echo, both in Mbps. Useful for diagnosing network performance issues.

server_info_crawled.name: System Resource Monitor
server_info_crawled.author: @abhinav7895/system-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide real-time system monitoring capabilities including CPU, memory, disk, network, battery, and internet speed metrics. Enable users to query detailed system resource usage and internet performance through easy-to-use tools. Enhance system awareness and diagnostics for better management and troubleshooting.

tools.name: get_cpu_usage

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@abhinav7895/system-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
